name: Sun
description: The Sun is a massive, glowing sphere of hot gases, primarily hydrogen and helium, located at the center of our solar system. It is about 1.39 million kilometers in diameter and produces energy through nuclear fusion in its core, where hydrogen atoms fuse into helium.

name: Mercury
description: Mercury is the smallest and closest planet to the Sun in our solar system, with a diameter of about 4,880 kilometers.

name: Venus
description: Venus, the second planet from the Sun, is similar in size and structure to Earth, with a diameter of about 12,104 kilometers.

name: Earth
description: Earth is the third planet from the Sun and the only known planet to support life. It has a diameter of about 12,742 kilometers and a diverse surface composed of continents and oceans.

name: Mars
description: Mars, the fourth planet from the Sun, is often called the "Red Planet" due to its reddish appearance, caused by iron oxide on its surface. It has a diameter of about 6,779 kilometers and features the largest volcano and the deepest canyon in the solar system.

name: Jupiter
description: Jupiter, the fifth planet from the Sun, is the largest in our solar system, with a diameter of about 139,820 kilometers.

name: Saturn
description: Saturn, the sixth planet from the Sun, is renowned for its stunning ring system composed of ice, rock, and dust particles. It is the second-largest planet in the solar system, with a diameter of about 116,460 kilometers.

name: Uranus
description: Uranus, the seventh planet from the Sun, is an ice giant with a diameter of about 50,724 kilometers. It is unique among the planets in our solar system for its sideways rotation axis, which causes it to essentially roll around the Sun.

name: Neptune
description: Neptune, the eighth and farthest planet from the Sun, is a gas giant with a diameter of about 49,244 kilometers. It is primarily composed of hydrogen, helium, and traces of methane, which give it a deep blue color. Neptune has a dynamic atmosphere with high-speed winds and large storms, including the Great Dark Spot and other smaller vortices.

name: Moon
description: The Moon is Earth's only natural satellite and the fifth largest moon in the Solar System. It has a diameter of about 3,474 kilometers. The Moon has a significant impact on Earth, including its tides. Its surface is covered with craters, mountains, and plains, and it has no atmosphere or magnetic field.
